comments.body:
Related to https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/22337.

Shall we allow different RESTMappers to have same aliases? I think we should just make the resources that got aliased to be qualified with group (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/api/install/install.go#L90), then we don't need the logic here.

And currently you see duplication because the aliases are stored in a global variable (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/api/meta/restmapper.go#L492), we should make it a member variable of DefaultRESTMapper.

> Shall we allow different RESTMappers to have same aliases? I think we should just make the resources that got aliased to be qualified with group

not sure about that... it makes sense for `hpa` to expand to `horizontalpodautoscalers` whether you're working in the `extensions` or `autoscaling` groups, but if the alias expanded to resource name AND group name in both mappers, then `hpa` would expand to `horizontalpodautoscalers.autoscaling,horizontalpodautoscalers.extensions`, which isn't what we want.

agree aliases need more thought, but I'd like to limit this PR to deduping the expanded list, which we know we want.

> then hpa would expand to horizontalpodautoscalers.autoscaling,horizontalpodautoscalers.extensions, which isn't what we want.

You are right. LGTM.
